abstract.text: Develop input methods and manage communication with client applications, candidates windows, and input method modes.
Types of candidates windows provide by the Input Method Kit.
The
class presents candidates to users and notifies the appropriate
object when the user selects a candidate.
are alternate characters for a given input sequence. The
class supports using a candidates window  in your input method; using
is optional. Not all input methods require them.
Returns a dictionary of the style attributes used for the candidates window..
Returns the state of the flag that determines whether the candidates window dismisses automatically.
Hides a candidates window, if it is visible.
Returns the initialized
object.
Returns whether or not the candidates window is visible.
Returns the style of the candidates window.
Returns an array of
objects where each
object represents a virtual key code.
Returns the key layout that maps virtual key codes to selection keys.
Sets the style attributes for the candidates window.
Sets the state of the flag that determines whether the candidates window dismisses automatically.
Sets the style of the candidates window.
Sets the selection keys for the candidates.
Sets the key layout that is used to map virtual key codes to characters.
Shows the candidates window.
Displays an annotation string in an annotation window.
Updates the candidates that are displayed in the candidates window.
Hints that suggest where to place the candidates window.
The
class provides a base class for custom input controller classes. The

class, which is allocated in the main function of an input method, creates an input controller object for each input session created by a client application. For every input session there is a corresponding
object.
The
class manages client connections to your input method.  When you write the main function for your input method, you create an
object.  You should never need to override this class.
The opacity level for a candidates window.
An abstract class that forms the basis of event and command processing in AppKit.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
